website_summaries.verdict: A supportive, durable shoe style that has occasional sizing issues.
pros: This ballet slipper gets top marks for its elegant style, excellent quality, and reasonable price
Users also love how well it conforms to the foot
cons: Some issues with sizing (too small or large), and a few had issues with stitches coming loose
Some customers also received shoes that did not have the elastic sewn to the shoe

customer_reviews.title: These are good quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy these all the time when I was younger. I decided to try these out again, and they don;t fit as well as they used too. They are snug in the heel, but very baggy in the toe. It's not that they are too long, but the the toe is wide, while the heel is narrow if that makes sense? These are good quality shoes, they just aren't shaped like they used to be, which is a tad disappointing. If you have a wider toe region, and slender heel, these will totally work for you!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my wife for ballet class and she ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife for ballet class and she loves them. She has a degree in ballet and has taught dance for years and recommends this brand, so while I know nothing about them, I'd say these are the way to go as she has over 20 years of experience.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T.

customer_reviews.title: Larger sizes fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was made on a dare by my male friend with REALLY large feet! He said if I could find ballet shoes in his size, he'd wear them! I was delighted to find these in size 14. Who would have thought?? And yes, he kept his end of the bargain and wears them around the house sometimes! His feet are actually size 13 and these are a little big, so they run true to size. Because he's not using them professionally, his opinion is that the little leather pieces on the bottom cause discomfort when walking. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Sizing has changed from several years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this model before, and loved them. These have the same size stamped on them as my old ones, but they seem at least a full size shorter, maybe two sizes. I feel like one of Cinderella's stepsisters: the shoe is "on," covering my heel for a minute or so, then it pops off. I would return them if I hadn't resolutely tried to stretch them enough that I could wear them. I've passed them on to another dancer with smaller feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Don't stop making these wide ballet shoes!
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find canvas ballet shoes in e width. For those of us who have wide feet, these are great. Finally, after 20 years, I can spread the ball of my foot the full width, and not be encumbered by the shoes. Furthermore, the leather shank piece under the ball of my foot is in the right place. No more rolling action hoping for the right spot on the shoe for turning. To date I have worn these 3 times for 2 hours each, and they still feel great.
customer_reviews.author: CWF

customer_reviews.title: Great slipper!
customer_reviews.text: My son dances ballet 4 days a week and is in multiple productions each year. These hold up well, fit well, and stay on! He loves them. the only time I have had to buy another pair is because he has grown out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof4

customer_reviews.title: All good but elastic needs to be sewed. Wish it came sewed
customer_reviews.text: All good but I wish elastic was already sewed. Creates a process for me to hire someone to sew the elastic costing almost double the price. Otherwise all good with the shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Rohit K. Sangal

customer_reviews.title: Sizes run too small
customer_reviews.text: I first ordered the size "14M," which was supposed to translate to an American make size 12. The shoe, however, was only 10.5 inches long. I returned it (for the first time using Amazon's really amazing return system) and then ordered the size "16M," thinking it would be better, It is better, but it is still a tight fit. However, since I intend to only use this in a casual manner, I can put up with the too tight fit for short periods of time. However, I will be reluctant in the future to order anything that is a particular size
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Zamperini

customer_reviews.title: Love these for wide feet average arch.
customer_reviews.text: I love these they make my feet look wonderful. I have a moderate arch and side feet. I wear a 8.5-9 street shoe and 9wide in these if you like your shoe to fit but not squeeze your feet .5-1 size up if your have a wide foot.
customer_reviews.author: Mhr75

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Tricky
customer_reviews.text: I wear a street size 7 and purchased 8W. I’m not sure if I should’ve sized down or just gone with normal instead of wide, but they bunch a little. The straps are already sewn into the back. Haven’t danced in them yet but have worn them around the house without discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: K Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: So glad we found some slippers that fit my son! So far these have lasted a semester, dress rehearsals and 2 performances. The best part is he is happy with them. I followed other’s advice to choose size.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal F.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for ballet shoes
customer_reviews.text: I went to buy these shoes from our local dance store and they were $30. This is a great price for good shoes. I ordered 2 sizes larger than street shoe size and they fit perfectly. I wear a womens size 11 and ordered a 13. They are tight but in a secure way. They are a nice sturdy cotton feeling fabric, very structured. They have loose elastic straps, only one side is sewn on when you receive them so you can make them comfortable and tight to fit your foot. I would recommend these shoes to everyone and will definitely be purchasing more!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: The best ballet slipper.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for 10 years. I wear 8 for street shoes, ordered 10M and worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Canvas shaped like toe box
customer_reviews.text: My son thought they looked more like womens shoes because the canves is actually shaped like a box for pointe. Well fitting shoe. Looks nice
customer_reviews.author: Beverly E.

customer_reviews.title: I am a latino man. I have been a ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a latino man. I have been a dancer for many years. I have bought this Sansha pro 1 slipper 2 times before, and both times you did not have the shoe in my skin color. I am a medium brown, and that color is never in stock. I know that Sansha makes them in my color because I always buy them in my skin color. When the shoes are bought in white (light pink) I have to dye them using foundation and liquid face makeup. Its a messy process. Please stock the Sansha Pro 1 in a mens 13W in the medium beige color. Its just a hassle to dye them my complexion. Sincerely, Jorge Quintero
customer_reviews.author: jorge quintero-troetsch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and ordered accordingly; meaning measure your feet! Select your shoes that way! Love this! they are comforrtable. And best of all they arrived on time! I tried getting this same type of shoe from another company thru Amazon. Lets say I was unsuccessful so I wenton a search again and found this company! I am glad!!I would order from this company on line through Amazon again. I can not say the same for the other dance company that list with Amazon! Sansha is the way to go!!! THanks
customer_reviews.author: Belly dance newbie

customer_reviews.title: A little snug
customer_reviews.text: I didn't understand the sizing and they were too small
customer_reviews.author: Eric Millard

customer_reviews.title: Fits tight but otherwise ok (some strap fray)
customer_reviews.text: The size is about right, but these fit a bit tight (even for ballet shoes). The elastic straps aren't the greatest quality, but the stitching on the body of the shoe appears to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: This is our second pair of this ballet slipper. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is our second pair of this ballet slipper. My daughter loves them. Fits as expected. She is about a 6.5/7 in US shoe size so we bought a size 9.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Painfully small
customer_reviews.text: Having had my child fitted in the past I knew her correct size. I’m not sure what happened here, but the shoes was about 2 sizes too small. It is a good quality shoe and works great when fitted properly, so I am unsure what happened this time.
customer_reviews.author: Kenia

customer_reviews.title: A definite keeper
customer_reviews.text: For dance or light aerobics this is a cute shoe. Light and easy to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Vi Van

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: We always by Sansha and have never been disappointed. Good quality and the price is reasonable too.
customer_reviews.author: Piwi

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe. Refer to Sansha sizing
customer_reviews.text: Find the manufacturer's size guide for proper fit. I'm a 10.5 street shoe and fit good and snug into a size 14 Sansha slipper. Sansha slippers are a bit bulky in front of the sole. Or it could be that I haven't mastered finding my center. Also, I pull the insole for a better feel of the dance floor.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: feet covers
customer_reviews.text: Product is excellent. Shipment is quick. Great company. For the frugal customer, the shoes are high quality at an affordable price. Sizing is perfect. Usually, I'd never buy shoes online due to sizing concerns. Chart helped immensely. Fabulous product. The only thing that detracts from the shoes is the placement or length of elastic straps. Not sure how to wear them like in the picture. Only one set of straps about six inches long on the inside near the heel. Ackward. Simple needle and thread fix. Buy these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Dm

customer_reviews.title: I normally wear a size 11 1/2 and bought these ...
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 11 1/2 and bought these in what should be the equivalent of a size 12, still a little snug. Overall though a quality ballet slipper that has lasted me for two terms with little sign of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Shlepzig

customer_reviews.title: I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a halloween costume. I am a 6'7" man so I didn't expect to have the option of a size 13 ballet slipper. However the fit is much too small. I would guess it's about a size and a half difference. I'm not sure how these are supposed to fit but I would imagine that they are supposed to fit like a second skin.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Too wide at the heel
customer_reviews.text: I wear street size 6 and I got 6 for this shoe which is also called US size 4. The length is right this time. However, the cut is to narrow for the toe while too wide for the heel. It's sturdy but the feel is like wearing a thick cloth on the feet. Don't like it and plan to return. It come with a carrying bag which is good.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are fine. Elastics are not Arwen in. Elastic pull in front can cause some issues.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor G

customer_reviews.title: True to amazon size
customer_reviews.text: You always want your ballet shoes to be a little snug fo that they are able expand and fit to your foot. Trust the size that amazon has provided (I'm 11/11.5 W so I got a 15/15.5 W). These shoes are pretty great for the canvas, but they do tend to loose traction easily. Try patting some water on the bottom before you dance. Otherwise it's a pretty good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jio del Toro

customer_reviews.title: Pink Ballet Slippers
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the reviews before buying so I knew they ran very small. I wear a ladies 10-11. I bought a 14 and it fits perfectly. they have cute ties that are sewn into the back of the slipper and then you sew the other end to the slipper so it fits comfortably around your ankle. They are perfect. I love them. Totally recommend just remember they run super small.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vigil

customer_reviews.title: Good value shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes for a 1-2 hour dance class. I have duck feet, so the big toe pinches a little, but generally, the width and length are pretty good. I wear a 7W street shoe, bought these in a 9W, and was happy with the fit. For the price, they do exactly what I need them to do.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Always a good shoe. Can't really go wrong with it. The only thing about the show is that it doesn't encompass the foot like a casing it is more like a puffy incasing fitted around the arch. still great for ballet and to each their own with shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tegan

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We had originally ordered a pair of Capizios from their own website and they did not fit and we were unable to return them as you can't return things if you put your foot in them... tho how you are supposed to tell if they fit, lord knows. We ordered these as a replacement. They fit, the price was right, they came quickly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Canvas class shoe
customer_reviews.text: This canvas ballet shoe is just right for ballet class. I bought it for my daughter to use in the Nutcracker this year, but she will be able to use it for class as well. She wears a street shoe size 9.5 N and needed this ballet shoe in a size 12N. They fit just right. I have bought this shoe before and it holds up well. I highly recommend this shoe for anyone who likes a canvas shoe for class.
customer_reviews.author: trexdix

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for someone with wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good canvas shoe with a comfortable heel. However, I purchased a narrow and there was still at least an inch of extra fabric at the widest point of my foot. The shoe was incredibly baggy and looked awful on my long, slender, feet. I would recommend this shoe only for those people with normal to wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: biochemkris

customer_reviews.title: sizes
customer_reviews.text: I wear a men's 11 and ordered a 15. fits fine. just don't dry them
customer_reviews.author: StageMeow

customer_reviews.title: The seams on these shoes could be felt all the ...
customer_reviews.text: The seams on these shoes could be felt all the way through. Very uncomfortable and have not used them for dance... wish I returned them in the allotted return timeframe.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: 6.5 street, 7M purchased, did not fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought 7M canvas and wear a street shoe size 6.5. I have bunions, but my feet are pretty standard in terms of width. These were too long (maybe by half an inch) and no amount of tightening would make them fit well and look good. The fabric kind of puckered at the soles, which made it uncomfortable at the sole without socks. I had to return these.
customer_reviews.author: nikki_at_nite

customer_reviews.title: Good quality dance shoe
customer_reviews.text: Emergency purchase at hot chocolate was spilled on her performance shoes! Good quality dance shoe!
customer_reviews.author: S.G.S

customer_reviews.title: Nice, quality slipper.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my daughter who had burned through several lesser quality pairs of slippers. I knew it was time to step it up when she started taping the toes with duct tape. I took the advice on the sizing suggestion, and it was spot on. So, she is a size 7, and the 9M fit to a tee. She seems very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: T. A.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoe size! I am trying ballet for the first time, and the shoe is great, much better than socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Order ONE SIZE UP
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 8M in street shoes and these fit. I had to buy a few pairs to ensure the right fit.
customer_reviews.author: austinmama

customer_reviews.title: Probably OK
customer_reviews.text: Left foot was fine. Right foot a little small - as far as I know my feet are the same size. They are canvas, so I expect to be able to stretch it quit a shoe tree.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Wexler

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Looks very good on my foot. Ordered 14 but they fit the same as my 13 same style and brand in white and the tag says 14. A little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: cups rock

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the shoes was great though and I would have happily kept them had ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 in regular shoes and found these to be a little too wide. Ballet shoes are supposed to fit snugly and these were just too big. The quality of the shoes was great though and I would have happily kept them had they fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected using size chart. I’m a women’s 7 1/2 -8 and I ordered a sansha 9.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: Definitely order 2 sizes larger than your street shoes. Toe area is "puckered" as shown in the picture. Not the best look. Elastics were sewn to the shoe on one end....I had to sew the other sides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Please get the sizing correct. I wear a 12 and ordered a 15. Still too short
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ward

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Overall satisfied with it. The adjustable strings are kind of thick and hard so towards the end of a dance class they mark my feet.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe! Be sure to read the sizing chart.
customer_reviews.text: Good ballet slipper, comfortable fit. Be sure to read the sizing chart! I wear a ladies 13 and ordered a 15 per the chart. Follow the chart and they fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Parrott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted - delivered promptly too - thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great slippers, but not the right size for me
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 6.5 size US Women's street shoe, and these were huge on me. I had no issues returning them, but I did find it odd that they didn't fit, as I am typically always a 6.5 (maybe sometimes a 6).
customer_reviews.author: YM Chang

customer_reviews.title: I bought a couple of sizes up as recommended. So far
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of sizes up as recommended. So far, I haven't had any issues, even with swollen last trimester of pregnancy feet. :) They are perfect for my "Dancing for Birth" class.
customer_reviews.author: R_U_U

customer_reviews.title: Great shipping!
customer_reviews.text: True to fit. My son’s favorite. Paid extra for expedited shipping and they arrived as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Wollitz

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Around the edging that goes across the top of your foot and around the back of the heel was very uncomfortable to wear. I sent them back and did not order replacements. the sizing seemed to run fairly true though.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Y

customer_reviews.title: Nice slipper
customer_reviews.text: It's a little hard to sew the straps but it doesn't take that long. It would be helpful to have someone assist you. It took me a little while to get used to the feel of the sole but once I did, it was very easy to move around in them.
customer_reviews.author: graphics guru

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has worn the canvas ballet slippers and this type for a few years. I'm used to sewing the straps and the shoes definitely fit her in the fall and then, she goes to the next size by spring. She really loves these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Maybe 5 STARS
customer_reviews.text: These ballet shoes are from the Discount Dance Supply company and although I have yet to use them, I can tell from the materials and craftsmanship that they are a solid choice. In terms of sizes, you can be confident that when purchasing this type of shoe, in general you can order your street shoe size and they will naturally stretch out as you dance. If they become too big, you can order 1/2 size down next time and wear socks with the older pair and have an extra pair to alternate with/ air out.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Chen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit well. Can't figure out how to cross the elastics, but it's ok
customer_reviews.author: JRV

customer_reviews.title: Those shoes are amazing, I’m loving it
customer_reviews.text: Those shoes are amazing, I’m loving it. I just had problems with my size cause I ordered one size more .
customer_reviews.author: Samadhi Benitez

customer_reviews.title: Quality ballet shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really great fitting ballet shoes. Quality look and feel. Excited to try them out in my class tomorrow
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Martin

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly! Definitely use the size chart on discount ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly! Definitely use the size chart on discount dance supply or on the sansha website. There is a whole size of difference on the sizing chart amazon offers.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these ballet slippers. The last ones I had purchased lasted for years.
customer_reviews.author: NGM

customer_reviews.title: very well
customer_reviews.text: very good product, comfortable, good quality, I recommend numbers ask them one or two more than you'd normally use, I mean, if you use size 7 order them in size 8 or 9.
customer_reviews.author: rosario reggie

customer_reviews.title: Great value and fit
customer_reviews.text: This has been my teenage ballet dancing son's go-to technique shoe for years! They last well and are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Angelovic

customer_reviews.title: Dance shoe sizes are NOT the same as street shoe sizes.  Size up.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears a 6.5-7 in American shoe sizes (38 in European). The size 9M slippers fit. The light pink is really light, more like very light pink/beige.
customer_reviews.author: Two kids mom

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Size is extra wide, but I can't get my foot in! Not wide.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: it's just too large... I think us 7 may be exactly the same size.. but it seems much larger
customer_reviews.author: Hanzhi Zhang

customer_reviews.title: tight with first wearing.
customer_reviews.text: I am comfortable with this slipper. After several practice sessions with the dance team, They are breaking in well and seem to be a very good fit.
customer_reviews.author: joshar

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect size
customer_reviews.text: Well built but sizing is wrong. Sold as 11 (US Women's 9), but it was really an 11. Too large. Will return
customer_reviews.author: Lens Mischief

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a friend and ordered 2 sizes smaller. Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: -S

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Need instructions on placement of straps. Unfortunately my feet are slightly larger than the shoes. But they seem very well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Siwsan G.

customer_reviews.title: ... second pair and I've found them to be very comfortable. I can also get them in my size
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and I've found them to be very comfortable. I can also get them in my size
customer_reviews.author: James Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: The price and quality are relatively good. For size, just follow the instructions it provided. a little tight but you won't feel it when dancing. And you need to sew the belt by yourself. Overall, it's cute! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect Size Description
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a MENS size 17 Medium Width. It is listed also as a size 13 Men's (but that is actually the women's size equivalent).
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: An excellent shoe for MARE
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for historical fencing students! If you practice on a natural floor or cushioned surface, this slipper-like cloth shoe is idea for Renaissance martial arts. Surprisingly, it closely reflects the footwear depicted in numerous 15th or 16th century European fighting styles and allows for all requisite foot movements while protecting stockings and hose. Much cheaper than sport fencing, wrestling, or wu shu footwear as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Kid Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Great affordable ballet slipper. My daughter has been doing ballet for 7 years and has tried many different slippers, but this one is her favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Borror

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: You actually have to sew these straps on. They do not come attached.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Joanna Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable slipper!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how they were made and very comfortable for my classes!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is awful, I wear a us woman's 10 wide, but I had to get a 14 w to get a good fit. Make sure you buy at least 1-2 sizes larger
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: ... larger than I my actual size because I don't like when my feet a too stuffy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these a bit larger than I my actual size because I don't like when my feet a too stuffy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Luna

customer_reviews.title: Great slippers for a child
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for comfortable, easy to put on slippers for a 7 year old and these are perfect. She loves them and can easily put them on and take them off when practice is finished. Sizes in these slippers are very difficult to figure out. The 3W fits a child who wears a size 2 US shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah AlAmri

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: As a ballet teacher that wears her shoes at least 5 days a week, I highly recommend this soft shoes. They fit perfectly, form to my feet very quickly and the split sole is great for showing off my arch.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Shriver

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be fine ballet slippers. I usually where mens 11-11.5 shoes, so I bought 15 W. They fit very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This shoe started to come apart on the sole after just several weeks of normal wear.
customer_reviews.author: Carolynn Luce

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: For a canvas slipper its well made and I like the fit better than other brands. The elastics are open so you can sew them where they are needed. I bought a size 8m and I wear a size 8 american street shoe.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fike

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit with Amazon sizing
customer_reviews.text: I read a review before buying that said size should be increased one from what Amazon's conversion table indicated. I chose not to, and they fit snugly but not too tight. I prefer my ballet shoes like this anyway, I think if you want a looser fit, stick to the advice about increasing size.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!! Love these
customer_reviews.text: These are so comfy - they're awesome!! I ordered the Capezio ballet shoes but returned those b/c they weren't comfortable - these are much better! I usually wear a size 8 in dress shoes - I ordered a size 8 in these and that was the perfect size for me. I love these and I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Inman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product is outstanding.. prompt delivery..sizing tips helped! Will purchase again.!
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes S. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Thank you. Was the size that I needed. Look great too.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: dance to the wii!
customer_reviews.text: really like these dance slippers! easy to move my feet - good fit (I wear size 8 street shoes, bought 10 in this) tacked my elastic straps with soft velcro so they are a little bit adjustable if I wear socks :-)
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Kennard

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit like it did before
customer_reviews.text: It was very baggy in the heel. Even though it was the same size I always buy. Super weird
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes just too small
customer_reviews.text: I got the ballet shoes in just in time that i needed them in. i was going to wear them for a ballet skit. Only i ordered a 9 1/2 because there was not a size scale i thought that since i wear a 9 in normal shoes that this would work.... but they didnt.... they were so small i couldnt get my foot in them, so I i didnt get to wear them at all. I had to buy some not so good looking ones from wal-mart. Is there a way i can return them?
customer_reviews.author: Summer Whittenberg

customer_reviews.title: I wear 6. 5-7 normal shoes. And I ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear 6.5-7 normal shoes. And I ordered 9 women. It just fits! But the sole are hard.
customer_reviews.author: siwei ye

customer_reviews.title: Classic slipper, great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, accurate sizing, and amazingly graceful/classic ballet slipper for class. Tie the strap first, next wrap it around your foot. Thank you for a great product Sansha! :)
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my daughter. So glad that I was able to find a narrow, what a difference it makes for her.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unisex Styling
customer_reviews.text: I am a non-dancer who wears these at home as slippers. The toe is not cut as low as it generally is in a traditional woman's ballet shoe. Criss-crossing elastic straps are pre-sewn into the back. You can adjust the size using the elastic cord sewn along the top. Order up 1 1/2 -- 2 sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer22

customer_reviews.title: Ordered my street shoe size
customer_reviews.text: I went against what the listing stated and ordered my street shoe size. The shoes fit perfect. Good price, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great! They are super comfortable and are good quality! The shipping only took 2 days. The only thing to watch for is to make sure and order 2 sizes bigger than your normal shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Balletgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great canvas slippers.
customer_reviews.text: The vendor was fast and the shoes were exactly as described. I would by these shoes again without hesitation. We are a dance supply outfit and these are one of the perferred styles of canvas slippers. These slippers come with a shoe bag.
customer_reviews.author: yetar

product_meta.title: Sansha Pro 1 Canvas Ballet Slipper
product_meta.description:
Sansha's Pro 1 ballet slipper is perfect for training or performing alike. Its lightweight canvas upper is double-lined for durability, and elastic straps secure the perfect fit.

In 1982, Franck Raoul-Duval, a 25-year-old Frenchman with a passion for dance and Russian history, created a new type of ballet shoe. After numerous trials and adjustments, he came up with an innovation that changed the lives of dancers everywhere. The split-sole ballet slipper, with its glove-like fit, was born. Sansha now manufactures an extensive range of dance shoes for everything from ballet to jazz, hip-hop to flamenco, and ballroom to tap. Sansha collaborates with dance professionals, teachers and store owners to remain a prominent brand in the dance capitals of the world.
